description: A simple JavaScript function to greet a person by name.

code_snippet: const numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]; const doubled = numbers.map(num => num * 2); console.log(doubled);
description: JavaScript array map function to double each element in an array.

code_snippet: for (let i = 0; i < 5; i++) { console.log(`Iteration number ${i}`); }
description: A basic for loop in JavaScript that iterates 5 times.
JavaScript object literal and accessing its properties.

code_snippet: const isAdult = age => age >= 18; console.log(isAdult(25)); console.log(isAdult(15));
description: Arrow function in JavaScript to check if a person is an adult.
Basic arithmetic operations in JavaScript, demonstrating order of operations.

code_snippet: const fruits = ['apple', 'banana', 'cherry']; if (fruits.includes('banana')) { console.log('Banana is in the list!'); }
description: JavaScript array includes method to check for the presence of an element.

code_snippet: function factorial(n) { return n <= 1 ? 1 : n * factorial(n - 1); } console.log(factorial(5));
description: Recursive JavaScript function to calculate the factorial of a number.

code_snippet: const numbers = [10, 20, 30, 40]; const sum = numbers.reduce((accumulator, currentValue) => accumulator + currentValue, 0); console.log(sum);
description: JavaScript array reduce method to calculate the sum of array elements.

code_snippet: setTimeout(() => { console.log('This message appears after 2 seconds.'); }, 2000);
description: JavaScript setTimeout function to execute code after a delay.
